$25,000 Be Bold Scholarship

Looking for students who stand out from the rest with their “boldness”. The organization describes their search for “boldness” as a search for strong character, relentless determination, and an unwavering commitment to revolutionizing our world for the better. The winner of the scholarship receives $25,000. This scholarship is strictly no-essay; your bold.org profile is your application. The scholarship runs on a rolling basis, so the next due date is December 1st, 2023. I would recommend this scholarship to everyone as it only takes about 15 minutes to apply.
Cooke Scholarship

Open to high school seniors who plan to enroll in a 4-year college once they graduate. Applicants should have a 3.5 GPA and demonstrate unmet financial need. The scholarship is up to $55,000 per year. The due date is November 16, 2023. Two academic recommendations, a counselor recommendation, school report, and transcript should all be submitted through Common App. Semifinalists are announced in January, and scholarship recipients are announced in March.
Ron Brown Scholarship

Offers: $40,000, mentoring, leadership experiences, and service opportunities
For: African American seniors enrolling in a 4-year degree-granting college
Requirements: Two letters of recommendation (at least one from high school counselor, teacher or principal, other can be from anyone) and two ~500 word essays (one is a question and one is about anything)
Deadlines: Application due by December 1st, rec letters due December 15th.
"Perseverance is Key" Scholarship

Will be granted to students who have demonstrated perseverance throughout their lives. For high school students who are at least 13 years old and undergraduate students who are currently studying in the United States. Special consideration will be given to minority students, students who have experienced foster care, and students who will/are first-generation college students. There will be 4 awards, composed of $1,000 each. Applicants need to respond to an essay prompt, which can be found on the scholarship’s website. The deadline to apply is 11:59 PM (EST) December 15th, 2023.
Jackie Robinson Scholarship Program

Open to minority high school seniors who plan to earn a bachelor's degree from a four-year university. Selected Jackie Robinson Foundation Scholars receive grants up to $30,000 throughout four years of university and are enrolled in the foundations "42 Strategies for Success Curriculum," which teaches students to navigate college and develop career and leadership skills. Applicants must be United States citizens and demonstrate financial need, academic excellence, leadership, commitment to community service, plan to attend a four-year college in the United States or a college affiliated with a United States-based college, and have earned less than 25% of college credits. The application requires one recommendation, demographic information, high school information, an unofficial transcript, college plans, activities and awards, household information, and four essays. Test scores (AP, PSAT, ACT, SAT) are optional. The application is due at 5p.m. EST on January 10, 2024. Applications will be reviewed between February–April and semifinalist interviews will occur April–May. Application status will be announced in June 2024.
Greenhouse Scholars Program

Open to current high school students planning to attend a four-year institution. Students must have a cumulative and unweighted GPA of 3.5 and must demonstrate financial need to apply (income must be no more than $80,000 annually). There are four parts to the application process for this program. The eligibility survey and initial questionnaire in the first round will close on November 21. The other rounds go through your academic information (rec letters, school transcripts, test scores), essay responses, video responses, and ends with an interview to determine acceptance into the program. Final decisions will be made on the week of April 25.
Burgerking scholarship program

Applicants should be high school seniors planning to enroll in a four-year college or university upon graduation. A minimum GPA of 3.5 is required to be eligible for this scholarship. Demonstrated unmet financial need is a significant consideration for selection.The Burger King Scholars Program offers scholarships that can be as substantial as $55,000 per year. To apply for the Burger King Scholars Program, applicants must go through the Common App platform. Required documentation includes two academic recommendations, a counselor recommendation, school report, and an official transcript. October 16 through December 15, 2023
10 Words or Less Scholorship

Must be at least 14-25 years of age and attending school in fall 2024. Mission has been to help connect students with the right schools for them. No minimum gpa, or test score requirement. No essay required. To apply to the 10 Words or Less Scholarship, applicants must go to the student scholarships website and write in 10 words or less why they deserve to get the scholarship. Applicants must also put a like on the facebook page. The scholarship value is $1000. The deadline to apply is November 15, 2023.
Niche $2,000 No-Essay Scholarship

Any high school student planning to attend a college or university in the next year is recommended to apply for this scholarship. It is a simple, no-essay scholarship that is solely dependent on your profile as a student. If won, the winner is rewarded with a no-strings-attached $2,000 scholarship. This scholarship runs every month and uses rolling deadlines; the next deadline is at the end of this month on October 31st, 2023.
Ambition Scholarship

Offers: $550
For: Female high school students
Requirements: 3.5+ GPA, any experience in volunteering or extracurriculars, 400-600 word response to question: What are your future dreams, and what have you done to set yourself on a path to achieving those dreams?
Deadlines: Jan 31, 2024
TheDream.US Scholarship

TheDream.US Scholarship is a vital opportunity for undocumented immigrant students pursuing higher education in the United States. This scholarship is designed for students who have shown exceptional academic promise and dedication, regardless of their immigration status. Recipients are awarded up to $33,000 over four years to help cover tuition and other educational expenses. The application process typically consists of multiple essays that allow students to share their personal stories, academic achievements, and future goals. The scholarship has two phases: an initial application round with a due date typically in late February, and a final round for selected finalists.
SAE.org Scholarships

SAE.org Scholarships are an excellent opportunity for students who are passionate about aerospace, automotive, and mobility engineering. These scholarships aim to provide financial support to students who are pursuing careers in these exciting fields. The amount of money awarded can vary from $1,000 to $10,000 or even more, depending on the specific scholarship. The application process usually involves writing essays, with the number of essays required varying from one scholarship to another. Typically, the application process consists of two phases: an initial application and, for selected candidates, an interview phase. Applications will be accepted for the 2023/24 academic year from February 1 - February 28, 2023.
Read Thread Foundation Scholarship

Aimed toward foreign, immigrant, and first-gen female students who plan to attend a US college as a first-year student in Fall 2024. The application includes short answer questions, two essays, and one recommendation. Applications open in February and are due February 28, 2024. Selected applicants will be interviewed, and final results will be released in June. Successful applicants receive $1,000, mentorship, and connections with other accomplished women.
Milken Scholars Program

The Milken Scholars Program selects outstanding, college-bound high school seniors who will graduate by the end of the academic year. High school guidance counselors and other staff members nominate students based on their demonstrated leadership skills, trouble with financials, and academic skill. Students must be graduating from a high school in Los Angeles County, New York City, or Washington, DC, as well as have a minimum GPA of 3.6, or above 90 in each course subject, in order to qualify. Scholarship winners receive assistance with career-related experiences and an annual monetary award of $2,000 for each of their four years of college. The deadline for nominations is November 17, and there are several stages to the application process after, with dates varying depending on your location.
Sallie Mae Scholarship

The Sallie Mae scholarship is $2,000 scholarship for United States students who are currently high school juniors or older. This scholarship does not require an essay or have any academic requirements. All that is needed is to meet the eligibility criteria and to submit the simple form on the Sallie Mae website. There are three upcoming deadlines for this scholarship: 11:59:59 PM on October 31st, 2023, 11:59:59 PM on November 30th, 2023, and 11:59:59 PM on December 31st, 2023. Winners are selected in a lottery-based system.
Wgu.edu

$2500 back to school scholarship open to all students. Main audience are business degrees. Goals is to make college easier for many students by making it cheaper. The application is free and just consists of legal information like your name. This is for the wgu school of business. No minimum gpa or requirements to apply.
Google Scholarship

Awarded to high school seniors planning to enroll in a Bachelors program in college to study computer science or technology. Applicants must have a strong academic record, demonstrate financial need, and have “leadership and passion for improving representation of underrepresented groups in computer science and technology”. There are two essay questions, and applicants submit a resumé, 1 letter of recommendation, and academic transcript as well. The deadline last year was in March, it looks like they haven’t updated their website for this school year. The scholarship is $10,000.
